resources.string:
"1852: Asteroid discovered by Italian astronomer Annibale de Gasparis

" "2010: Composition of asteroid Psyche discovered to be all metal

"

"2022: Launch of Psyche spacecraft from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center, FL

" "2023: Psyche spacecraft flyby of Mars

" "2026: Psyche spacecraft arrives in asteroid’s orbit

" "2026-2027: Psyche spacecraft orbits the Psyche asteroid for 21 months

"

string-array.item: A
B
C
D
E

string-array.name: phase_titles
string-array.item: Phase A: CONCEPT STUDY
Phase B: PRELIMINARY DESIGN OF ALL INSTRUMENTS AND SPACECRAFT
Phase C: CRITICAL DESIGN AND BUILD
Phase D: INSTRUMENT AND SPACECRAFT BUILD, SHIP AND LAUNCH
Phase E: GRAVITY ASSIST, ARRIVAL AND ORBIT
Phase F: MISSION CLOSEOUT

string-array.name: phase_A_info
string-array.item: Item 1
Item 2

string-array.name: phase_A_summary
string-array.item: 1852: Asteroid discovered by Italian astronomer Annibale de Gasparis
2010: Composition of asteroid Psyche discovered to be all metal
September 2015: Psyche Mission selected for NASA concept study
Details about Concept Study
November 2016: Presentation for NASA\'s Discovery Program
Details about NASA on-site Presentation

string-array.name: phase_A_details
string-array.item: "1852: Asteroid discovered by Italian astronomer Annibale de Gasparis\n\n"
"2010: Composition of asteroid Psyche discovered to be all metal\n\n"

"In September of 2015, the Psyche Mission (as it was proposed in Step 1) was selected " "by NASA to develop a detailed concept study for consideration for NASA\’s " "Discovery Program.

" "Step 1 is the initial proposal stage; the team had been working on the idea " "since 2011 and submitted a 256 page Step 1 proposal that was selected for the " "Phase A concept study.

"

"A large team worked on the study, led by the Principal Investigator, " "Lindy Elkins-Tanton, and consisting of an expansive team that included scientists, " "engineers, project managers, schedulers, financial modelers, graphic designers, " "and marketing leads from ASU, JPL, SSL, as well as more than a dozen other " "universities and research organizations.\n\n"

"In November of 2016, the team presented the proposed mission to 30 NASA reviewers " "during a nine-hour \“site visit\” which included a tour of SSL\’s high bay, " "where the Psyche chassis will be built.\n\n"

"The site visit is an intense, highly technical in-person review done by a select " "group of science, technical, and industry experts. They review every detail of the " "proposed mission, from concept and design, to execution and science application, " "as well as how the mission personnel from different institutions work together " "as a team.\n\n"

string-array.name: phase_B_summary
string-array.item: January 2017: Science and engineering teams
March 2019: Preliminary Design Review
May 2019: Key Decision Point C

string-array.name: phase_B_details
string-array.item: "Science and engineering teams on the mission are designing the spacecraft and the instruments that will be used to analyze the asteroid.\n\n"
"March 2019, the team will undergo project and flight system Preliminary Design Review.\n\n"
"May 2019, the team reaches Key Decision Point C, which will give the team the official approval to move to the next phase (Phase C).\n\n"

string-array.name: phase_C_summary
string-array.item: May 2019: Science and engineering teams begin to build
April 2020: Project and Flight System Critical Design Review
May 2020: Spacecraft body completion
January 2021: Systems Integration Review

string-array.name: phase_C_details
string-array.item:
"Science and engineering teams begin to build their instruments.

" "The instruments consist of a magnetometer, a multispectral imager, and a gamma ray and neutron spectrometer.

" "The mission will use an X-band radio telecommunications system to measure Psyche\’s gravity field to high precision. When combined with topography derived from onboard imagery, this will provide information on the interior structure of Psyche.

" "The mission will also test a sophisticated new laser communication technology that encodes data in photons (rather than radio waves) to communicate between a probe in deep space and Earth. Using light instead of radio allows the spacecraft to communicate more data in a given amount of time.

"
"April 2020, the teams will undergo Project and Flight System Critical Design Review, this is an integral step in the instrument engineering process.\n\n"
"The bus or \“body\” of the spacecraft will be completed by May 2020.\n\n"

"In January 2021, the team will conduct the Systems Integration Review to ensure that the system is ready to be integrated. The last step in Phase C is Key Decision Point D that will give the team the official approval to move to the next phase.\n\n"

string-array.name: phase_D_summary
string-array.item: DDD
